abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Structural Adjustment Project
            loan will continue to support the Government's strategy
            of structural adjustment and economic recovery. The strategy
            aims at creating a more open, export-oriented economy in
            which the efficiency of the productive sectors is enhanced
            through exposure to greater international competition and
            through refocused public services. To this end, the major
            components of the program include: (i) improving the
            efficiency of the public sector; (ii) reorienting the
            incentive structure in the industrial sector; (iii) removing
            some rigidities in the labor market; and (iv) reducing
            distortional interventions in agriculture. The economic
            program supported by the loan is expected to result in
            substantially higher levels of economic growth and
            employment than would otherwise occur. To realize its
            potential the program requires a favorable international
            environment: continued growth in the industrialized
            countries, recovery in Latin America, low interest rates and
            oil prices, and open international markets.
